intro: Rohria ciliaris, commonly known as the velvetleaf rohria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its fibrous roots and hairy foliage make it distinctive within its native habitat.
